>> incredibly useful you should know about
is the layered control rig. A layered
control rig is a special kind of control
rig that includes a backward solve. And
that that means is that instead of
having to bake all your animations if
you want to adjust them, it can actually
convert those animations from a sequence
into a control that you can animate on
top of that. Now you're animating on top
of it. So that has its own special
qualities. It's not replacing it, but it
can be very useful for things like this.
See how his hands are going through his
body. you know, in this case, even
though you could see ourselves

you don't even realize that there's
there's clipping problems, but you can
apply a layered control rig. You just
have to go to the uh the body, you go to
control rig, and if it's layered, only
the layered ones will come up, which is
only the animation, the control rigs
that have backward solve in this
skeleton come up. And once you select

having the animation only be what was
recorded with the the motion capture,
you can make changes. So, here we have
keys. So, now his hand, if you notice,

active level sequence and drop a camera

follow cameras. Sometimes you want to

game engine, we can mitigate this by
adding some logic to our cine cameras

performers in real time. The cine camera
already allows you to procedurally look
at and focus on a specific actor. So, we
just added our own follow blueprint on
top of this using simple interpolation
comparisons. We could even adjust how
